cards.name: Abu Ja'far
cards.text: When Abu Ja'far dies, destroy all creatures blocking or blocked by it. They can't be regenerated.

cards.name: Circle of Protection: Artifacts
cards.text: {2}: The next time an artifact source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

cards.name: Repentant Blacksmith
cards.text: Protection from red

cards.name: War Elephant

rulings.text: A maximum of one nonbanding creature can join an attacking band no matter how many creatures with banding are in it.
Creatures in the same band must all attack the same player or planeswalker.

If a creature with banding attacks, it can team up with any number of other attacking creatures with banding (and up to one nonbanding creature) and attack as a unit called a “band.” The band can be blocked by any creature that could block a single creature in the band. Blocking any creature in a band blocks the entire band. If a creature with banding is blocked, the attacking player chooses how the blockers’ damage is assigned.
If a creature in combat has banding, its controller assigns damage for creatures blocking or blocked by it. That player can ignore the damage assignment order when making this assignment.

cards.text: Trample; banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)

cards.name: Dandân
cards.text:
Dandân can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.
When you control no Islands, sacrifice Dandân.

cards.name: Fishliver Oil
cards.text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature has islandwalk. (It can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)

cards.name: Giant Tortoise
cards.text: Giant Tortoise gets +0/+3 as long as it's untapped.

cards.name: Sindbad

rulings.text: If the draw is replaced by another effect, none of the rest of Sindbad’s ability applies, even if the draw is replaced by another draw (such as with Enduring Renewal).
To avoid confusion, reveal the card you draw before putting it with the rest of the cards in your hand.

cards.text: {T}: Draw a card and reveal it. If it isn't a land card, discard it.

cards.name: Twiddle

rulings.text: The decision whether or not to tap or untap is made on resolution. This is not a modal spell.
This is not a toggle effect. If you use Twiddle to tap a card and before it takes effect your opponent taps it, Twiddle will not automatically untap the card.

cards.text: You may tap or untap target artifact, creature, or land.

cards.name: Cuombajj Witches

rulings.text: Even though the opponent chooses a target, you control the ability. An opponent can't target a creature they control with hexproof.
You choose which opponent chooses the second target. It doesn't have to be the opponent who controls (or is) the first target.

cards.text: {T}: Cuombajj Witches deals 1 damage to any target and 1 damage to any target of an opponent's choice.

cards.name: Hasran Ogress

rulings.text: You either take damage or pay the 2 mana during resolution.

cards.text: Whenever Hasran Ogress attacks, it deals 3 damage to you unless you pay {2}.

cards.name: Junún Efreet
cards.text:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Junún Efreet unless you pay {B}{B}.

cards.name: Xenic Poltergeist

rulings.text: Wears off at the beginning of the upkeep, not during upkeep.

A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

cards.text: {T}: Until your next upkeep, target noncreature artifact becomes an artifact creature with power and toughness each equal to its mana value.

cards.name: Yawgmoth Demon

rulings.text: The sacrificing of an artifact is not mandatory. You can choose not to sacrifice an artifact but will pay the consequences.

cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may sacrifice an artifact. If you don't, tap Yawgmoth Demon and it deals 2 damage to you.

cards.name: Aladdin

rulings.text: Aladdin's ability can take control of more than one artifact, although only one each time the ability is used.
You do not lose control of the permanent if it stops being an artifact. The validity of the target is checked only on announcement and resolution of the ability.

cards.text: {1}{R}{R}, {T}: Gain control of target artifact for as long as you control Aladdin.

cards.name: Ali Baba

rulings.text: The ability may tap walls even when Ali Baba is tapped or just entered the battlefield, since the activation cost doesn’t include {T}.
This ability may be used to tap more than one Wall per turn if you have enough mana, since tapping isn’t part of the activation cost.

cards.text: {R}: Tap target Wall.

cards.name: Bird Maiden
cards.text: Flying

cards.name: Detonate

rulings.text: If the artifact becomes an illegal target before resolution, then no damage is done.

cards.text: Destroy target artifact with mana value X. It can't be regenerated. Detonate deals X damage to that artifact's controller.

cards.name: Goblin Artisans
cards.text: {T}: Flip a coin. If you win the flip, draw a card. If you lose the flip, counter target artifact spell you control that isn't the target of an ability from another creature named Goblin Artisans.

cards.name: Hurr Jackal
cards.text: {T}: Target creature can't be regenerated this turn.

cards.name: Ironclaw Orcs
cards.text: Ironclaw Orcs can't block creatures with power 2 or greater.

cards.name: Amulet of Kroog
cards.text: {2}, {T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to any target this turn.

cards.name: Argothian Pixies
cards.text:
Argothian Pixies can't be blocked by artifact creatures.
Prevent all damage that would be dealt to Argothian Pixies by artifact creatures.

cards.name: Ashnod's Altar
cards.text: Sacrifice a creature: Add {C}{C}.

cards.name: Ashnod's Battle Gear
cards.text:
You may choose not to untap Ashnod's Battle Gear during your untap step.
{2}, {T}: Target creature you control gets +2/-2 for as long as Ashnod's Battle Gear remains tapped.

cards.name: Ashnod's Transmogrant

rulings.text: It’s the ability, not the counter that makes the creature an artifact. The creature remains an artifact even if the +1/+1 counter is removed.

cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice Ashnod's Transmogrant: Put a +1/+1 counter on target nonartifact creature. That creature becomes an artifact in addition to its other types.

cards.name: Battering Ram

rulings.text: A maximum of one nonbanding creature can join an attacking band no matter how many creatures with banding are in it.
Creatures in the same band must all attack the same player or planeswalker.

If a creature with banding attacks, it can team up with any number of other attacking creatures with banding (and up to one nonbanding creature) and attack as a unit called a “band.” The band can be blocked by any creature that could block a single creature in the band. Blocking any creature in a band blocks the entire band. If a creature with banding is blocked, the attacking player chooses how the blockers’ damage is assigned.
If a creature in combat has banding, its controller assigns damage for creatures blocking or blocked by it. That player can ignore the damage assignment order when making this assignment.

cards.text:
At the beginning of combat on your turn, Battering Ram gains banding until end of combat. (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's blocking.)
Whenever Battering Ram becomes blocked by a Wall, destroy that Wall at end of combat.

cards.name: Bronze Tablet

rulings.text: If the card being targeted by the Bronze Tablet is removed before Tablet takes effect, then the Tablet ability doesn’t resolve and it remains tapped.
If using a copy of the Tablet, you must trade the copy card to your opponent just like you would have traded the Tablet.
You can take control of your opponent’s Tablet and in the trade you only have to give them back their Tablet.
You can’t choose to pay 10 life if you have less than 10 life, but you may choose to give up the game immediately. This has roughly the same effect.

If the tablet is not still on the battlefield when the ability resolves, it is not exiled. The other player still has the choice to pay 10 life, and you still become the owner of their card if they choose not to do so.

cards.text:
Remove Bronze Tablet from your deck before playing if you're not playing for ante.
Bronze Tablet enters the battlefield tapped.
{4}, {T}: Exile Bronze Tablet and target nontoken permanent an opponent owns. That player may pay 10 life. If they do, put Bronze Tablet into its owner's graveyard. Otherwise, that player owns Bronze Tablet and you own the other exiled card.

cards.name: Clay Statue
cards.text: {2}: Regenerate Clay Statue.

cards.name: Clockwork Avian

rulings.text: Can attack or block even if it has no counters.
If the ability to add counters resolves when there are already the maximum number of counters on it, any counters over the maximum are simply not added.
Loses a counter even if it is affected by a Fog-like effect which prevents it from dealing damage.

cards.text:
Flying
Clockwork Avian enters the battlefield with four +1/+0 counters on it.
At end of combat, if Clockwork Avian attacked or blocked this combat, remove a +1/+0 counter from it.
{X}, {T}: Put up to X +1/+0 counters on Clockwork Avian. This ability can't cause the total number of +1/+0 counters on Clockwork Avian to be greater than four. Activate only during your upkeep.

cards.name: Colossus of Sardia

rulings.text: The ability that untaps it during your upkeep has been returned to an activated ability. There is no restriction on how many times it can be untapped during your upkeep with this ability.

cards.text:
Trample (This creature can deal excess combat damage to the player or planeswalker it's attacking.)
Colossus of Sardia doesn't untap during your untap step.
{9}: Untap Colossus of Sardia. Activate only during your upkeep.

cards.name: Coral Helm
cards.text: {3}, Discard a card at random: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Cursed Rack

rulings.text: The effect of lowering the maximum hand size makes it so the player discards down to 4 cards (instead of the usual 7) during the cleanup step.

You choose one opposing player just as this card is entering the battlefield and it only affects that one player. This choice is not changed even if this card changes controllers. It becomes useless but stays on the battlefield if the chosen player leaves the game.

If multiple effects modify your hand size, apply them in timestamp order. For example, if you put Null Profusion (an enchantment that says your maximum hand size is two) onto the battlefield and then a player puts Cursed Rack onto the battlefield choosing you, your maximum hand size will be four. However, if those permanents entered the battlefield in the opposite order, your maximum hand size would be two.

cards.text:
As Cursed Rack enters the battlefield, choose an opponent.
The chosen player's maximum hand size is four.

cards.name: Cyclone
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, put a wind counter on Cyclone, then sacrifice Cyclone unless you pay {G} for each wind counter on it. If you pay, Cyclone deals damage equal to the number of wind counters on it to each creature and each player.

cards.name: Erhnam Djinn

rulings.text: If there are no creatures your opponent controls to target at the beginning of your upkeep, ignore this ability.
If you have more than one Djinn, you can have all of them target the same creature with their ability.

In multiplayer games you can choose a different player’s creature each upkeep. You are forced to pick a creature that some opponent controls if there is at least one creature on the battlefield that is a legal target.

cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, target non-Wall creature an opponent controls gains forestwalk until your next upkeep. (It can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)

cards.name: Feldon's Cane
cards.text: {T}, Exile Feldon's Cane: Shuffle your graveyard into your library.

cards.name: Ghazbán Ogre
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if a player has more life than each other player, the player with the most life gains control of Ghazbán Ogre.

cards.name: Grapeshot Catapult
cards.text: {T}: Grapeshot Catapult deals 1 damage to target creature with flying.

cards.name: Jalum Tome

rulings.text: You draw a card and discard a card all while Jalum Tome's ability is resolving. Nothing can happen in between, and no player can choose to take actions.

cards.text: {2}, {T}: Draw a card, then discard a card.

cards.name: Jeweled Bird

rulings.text: The card is exchanged for your entire contribution to the ante. This means that it replaces all the cards if you have more than one already contributed.

cards.text:
Remove Jeweled Bird from your deck before playing if you're not playing for ante.
{T}: Ante Jeweled Bird. If you do, put all other cards you own from the ante into your graveyard, then draw a card.

cards.name: Metamorphosis

rulings.text: This mana may be used on additional costs to cast the spell, such as Kicker.
Players can only respond once this spell has been cast and all its costs have been paid. No one can try to destroy the creature you sacrificed to prevent you from casting this spell.
You must sacrifice exactly one creature to cast this spell; you cannot cast it without sacrificing a creature, and you cannot sacrifice additional creatures.

cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice a creature.
Add X mana of any one color, where X is 1 plus the sacrificed creature's mana value. Spend this mana only to cast creature spells.

cards.name: Nafs Asp

rulings.text: If it damages a player twice, they get to pay or take damage twice during their next draw step.
If its damage gets redirected to its controller, it will still trigger the ability.
The ability does not cause itself to trigger again. It cause loss of life, and not damage.
The player can pay the {1} mana at any time after damage is done before the draw step of that player’s turn. People commonly pay during upkeep.

cards.text: Whenever Nafs Asp deals damage to a player, that player loses 1 life at the beginning of their next draw step unless they pay {1} before that draw step.

cards.name: Obelisk of Undoing
cards.text: {6}, {T}: Return target permanent you both own and control to your hand.

cards.name: Rakalite

rulings.text: Can be used any number of times during the turn before it leaves the battlefield.
Only returns to your hand if it is still on the battlefield at the end of the turn. If it leaves the battlefield, it does not return.

cards.text: {2}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to any target this turn. Return Rakalite to its owner's hand at the beginning of the next end step.

cards.name: Sandstorm
cards.text: Sandstorm deals 1 damage to each attacking creature.

cards.name: Shapeshifter

rulings.text: The ability that lets you choose a new number is a triggered ability that triggers only once each upkeep.
The ability that sets its power and toughness is a characteristic-defining ability. This means it applies before any other effects that modify power and/or toughness.

cards.text:
As Shapeshifter enters the battlefield, choose a number between 0 and 7.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may choose a number between 0 and 7.
Shapeshifter's power is equal to the last chosen number and its toughness is equal to 7 minus that number.

cards.name: Tawnos's Wand
cards.text: {2}, {T}: Target creature with power 2 or less can't be blocked this turn.

cards.name: Tawnos's Weaponry
cards.text:
You may choose not to untap Tawnos's Weaponry during your untap step.
{2}, {T}: Target creature gets +1/+1 for as long as Tawnos's Weaponry remains tapped.

cards.name: Tetravus

rulings.text: Any +1/+1 counter which is on this card can be turned into a Tetravite token. It does not care where the +1/+1 counter came from.
If the Tetravus is destroyed when the Tetravites are off the card, they are not destroyed, they are just orphaned.
Only Tetravites from this specific Tetravus may be used for the ability. Ones from a different Tetravus can't.
This card now has two upkeep-triggered abilities. Its controller chooses the order they are put on the stack, and thus the order in which they resolve each upkeep.

cards.text:
Flying
Tetravus enters the battlefield with three +1/+1 counters on it.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may remove any number of +1/+1 counters from Tetravus. If you do, create that many 1/1 colorless Tetravite artifact creature tokens. They each have flying and "This creature can't be enchanted."
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may exile any number of tokens created with Tetravus. If you do, put that many +1/+1 counters on Tetravus.

cards.name: Triskelion

rulings.text: If Triskelion has damage marked on it, activating its ability may cause that damage to become lethal. For example, say a Triskelion with two +1/+1 counters on it has been dealt 2 damage earlier in the turn. If you activate its ability by removing a +1/+1 counter from it, it now has 2 toughness and is destroyed as a state-based action. You won’t be able to remove the other +1/+1 counter from it to activate its ability again. The first activation of the ability will still resolve.

If you activate the ability of an attacking or blocking Triskelion during the declare blockers step, it will deal less combat damage as a result. If you wait until the combat damage step, but Triskelion is dealt lethal damage, it’ll be destroyed before you get a chance to activate its ability.

cards.text:
Triskelion enters the battlefield with three +1/+1 counters on it.
Remove a +1/+1 counter from Triskelion: It deals 1 damage to any target.

cards.name: Urza's Avenger

rulings.text: The -1/-1 is not permanent. It lasts until the end of the turn as do the abilities that are granted.

cards.text: {0}: Urza's Avenger gets -1/-1 and gains your choice of banding, flying, first strike, or trample until end of turn. (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)

cards.name: Wall of Spears
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
First strike

cards.name: Yotian Soldier
cards.text: Vigilance

cards.name: City of Brass

rulings.text: If you tap City of Brass while you are casting a spell or activating an ability, its ability will trigger and wait. When you finish casting that spell or activating that ability, City of Brass's triggered ability is put on the stack on top of it. City of Brass's ability will resolve first.

On the other hand, you can tap City of Brass, put its triggered ability on the stack, and then respond to that ability by casting an instant or activating an ability using that mana. In that case, the instant spell or activated ability will resolve first.
The first ability triggers no matter how the land becomes tapped.

cards.text:
Whenever City of Brass becomes tapped, it deals 1 damage to you.
{T}: Add one mana of any color.

cards.name: Mishra's Factory

rulings.text: A noncreature permanent that becomes a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature. Notably, if you turn Mishra's Factory into a creature on the turn it entered the battlefield, you won't be able to then activate its first or last abilities.
After it becomes a creature, Mishra's Factory will still have all its abilities.

cards.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{1}: Mishra's Factory becomes a 2/2 Assembly-Worker artifact creature until end of turn. It's still a land.
{T}: Target Assembly-Worker creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
